intro: Platylobium alternifolium, commonly known as the alternate-leaf pincushion, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescence of bright yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a valued species in native gardens and conservation efforts.
